images.place: Ping Pang Pong, Las Vegas, Nevada

description: A [flaky pastry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_flaky_pastry) with a variety of fillings, commonly available in Chinese bakeries. The version with BBQ pork is often available as dim sum. In English, these are often listed as cakes, doughnuts, pastries, puff pastries, or just puffs.

images.place: Dim Sum Cafe, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
A [flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with BBQ pork.

{叉燒} is *BBQ pork*, and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so {叉燒酥} is *BBQ pork pastry*.

Baked or deep-fried [flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with shredded daikon (often called *radish* or *turnip*, so this is sometimes listed as *radish puffs* or *turnip puffs*). {蘿蔔} is [daikon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daikon), and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 蘿蔔酥 is *daikon pastry*.

Baked or deep-fried [flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with [durian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durian) or durian-flavored cream.

**Warning**

[Durian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durian) has a strong flavor and odor, so it's a notoriously acquired taste.

{榴莲} is [durian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durian), and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 榴蓮酥 is *durian pastry*.

images.place: Rice to Go, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
Sweetened fried dough in an elliptical shape (really, like a doughnut) that supposedly resembles an ox tongue or horse ear, so it's also known as ox-tongue or horse-ear pastry.

{牛脷} is [ox tongue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beef_tongue), and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so {牛脷酥} is *ox tongue pastry*.

Pineapple cakes, small butter shortcakes with a pineapple filling, are a Taiwanese specialty.

[鳳梨](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%B3%B3%E6%A2%A8) is *pineapple*, and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so [鳳梨酥](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%B3%B3%E6%A2%A8%E9%85%A5) is *pineapple pastry*.

[flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with taro paste.

**Characters**

{芋} is [taro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taro) (short for {芋頭}), [泥](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%B3%A5) is *paste*, and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry),

[Flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with [salted egg yolk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salted_duck_egg).

[蛋黃](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%9B%8B%E9%BB%83) is *egg yolk* ({蛋} is *egg*, and [黃](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%BB%83) is *yellow*, so 蛋黃 is *egg yellow*). {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 蛋黃酥 is *egg yolk pastry*.

[Flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with preserved egg.

{酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 蛋黃酥 is *egg yolk pastry*.

[Flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with [mung bean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mung_bean).

[綠豆](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B6%A0%E8%B1%86) is [mung bean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mung_bean) ([綠](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B6%A0) is *green*, and {豆} is *bean*, but *green bean* is actually *mung bean* in Chinese), and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 蛋黃酥 is *mung bean pastry*.

[Flaky puff pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry) filled with [lotus seed paste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lotus_seed_paste).

**Characters**

{蓮蓉} is [lotus seed paste](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lotus_seed_paste) ({蓮} is *lotus*, and [蓉](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%93%89 is *paste*)), and {酥} is [pastry](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou_(pastry)pastry), so 蓮蓉酥 is *lotus seed paste pastry*.
